author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In sterling's swift ascent, a tale of sorrow weaved,
When Bank of England's might, inflation’s bane conceiv'd,
By forces from without, their efforts all but thieved,
A melancholy song for those who had believ'd.

In London's market fair, where metals mixed by chance,
A dolar's strength foretold, gold's weakened countenance,
Through looming debt and doubt that plagued the fiscal dance,
A somber ode for those who chased the fleeting glace.

Betwixt the spice-filled lands, fair Indonesia's shore,
Her central bank did stand, as they had done before,
The seven-day reverse repo rate in guarded store,
A chant for those who sought, seeking change evermore.

feedItems.title: Concerns Over BOE's Ability to Control Inflation Hits Sterling
feedItems.description: Sterling’s positive reaction to Wednesday’s higher-than-expected U.K. inflation data was brief given concerns the BOE will struggle to contain price pressures due to factors outside its control, Commerzbank said.

feedItems.title: Metals Mixed Amid Dollar Strength
feedItems.description: Base metals were slightly firmer in London, with gold prices weaker, as worries over the U.S. debt ceiling and uncertainty about the Fed’s next move on rates, dominating markets.

feedItems.title: Indonesia's Central Bank Stands Pat
feedItems.description: Bank Indonesia maintained its benchmark seven-day reverse repo rate, as expected in a WSJ poll.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Europe's midst, oil's blackened sea
Holds ground, with gains unyielding be,
By data spurred, the Saudi creed
As tyrants warn, their needs to feed.

To Dortmund's borough, tidings fair
A rise in confidence fills the air,
Minus twenty-four, forecast divine,
By GfK, the purse strings now unwind.

Bold Coca-Cola, in valiant quest,
Reaffirms its target, meets the test,
Guidance steady, with margins gold,
Eternal growth its fate foretold.

feedItems.title: Oil Holds Gains Following US Stocks Data
feedItems.description: Oil prices edged lower in Europe but held onto the bulk of gains made this week following bullish inventory data and a warning from the Saudi Arabia energy minister.

feedItems.title: German Consumer Morale to Improve Further
feedItems.description: Germany’s forward-looking consumer-sentiment index forecast confidence to tick up to minus 24.2 in June, the strongest level since April 2022, according to GfK, as income expectations brightened.

feedItems.title: Coca-Cola HBC Backs Outlook, Upgrades Targets
feedItems.description: Coca-Cola HBC reiterated its fiscal 2023 guidance and updated its medium-term financial targets for revenue and earnings margin growth, reflecting a positive outlook for its markets.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of German land, a tale of woe,
Recession's grip doth steal their show.
With meager growth and pinching purse,
Inflation's thirst, it stings and curse.

Generali, a worthy beast,
In profits gain, it hath increased.
Confirm'd, their plan to title steer,
By yon now bow, through twenty-four.

And Gucci's sire, Kering, dost join,
With GSK, a nature's coin,
To set a standard wise and fair,
Undo the loss our world doth wear.

feedItems.title: Germany Enters Recession After GDP Revised Down
feedItems.description: Germany’s GDP contracted 0.3% in the first quarter, according to a second estimate, as household expenditure was squeezed by high inflation.

feedItems.title: Generali Backs Targets After Profits Jump
feedItems.description: Generali confirmed the targets of its strategic plan for 2024 after it posted increased premiums and sharply higher profits in the first quarter.

feedItems.title: Gucci-Owner Kering, Drugmaker GSK and Others Are Developing Global Targets on Nature Loss
feedItems.description: Setting standards can help companies move from multiple and conflicting definitions of what is enough action for nature, to consistent and replicable guidance.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Of Hellenic and Teutonic bonds I sing,
In tender verse their stable union framed,
Ere June's full course hath run, their value cling,
One-hundred forty points their link proclaimed.

Oh weary woes! United vestige falls,
In lowered grounds and wanton air consumed,
Profits reduced, the hare lament's sweet calls,
Inflations grown and costs to heights resume.

Now waned the case, to Ericsson's delight,
The court declares from whence the shadows cast,
In gallant truth, investors reclaimed their right,
In yon Iraq their pretensions lie in past.

feedItems.title: Greek-German Bond Yield Spread Expected to Stabilize Near Term
feedItems.description: The 10-year Greek-German government bond yield spread has reached Citi’s target of 140 basis points and looks to stabilize there until the second election in June, it said.

feedItems.title: United Utilities Profit Slides, Misses Consensus
feedItems.description: United Utilities reported a 28% drop in underlying profit, reflecting lower consumption, higher inflation and increased operational costs.

feedItems.title: Court Dismisses Ericsson Shareholder Lawsuit
feedItems.description: Ericsson said a U.S court has rejected a claim by certain shareholders that the company misled investors over its business dealings and compliance in Iraq.
